properties.title: Installing External Link Picker Button in the RichText Editor

section.name: Installing External Link Picker Button in the RichText Editor

subsection.name: Add Dependencies
subsection.p: Make sure you have the forge Maven2 repository reference and dependency definition in the root pom.xml of your project.

div.source:
<repositories>
<!-- SNIP -->
<repository> <id>hippo-maven2-forge</id> <name>Hippo Maven 2 Forge Repository</name> <url>http://maven.onehippo.com/maven2-forge/</url> </repository>
<!-- SNIP -->
</repositories>
<!-- SNIP -->
<dependencyManagement>
<!-- SNIP -->
<dependencies>
<!-- SNIP -->
<!-- NOTE: You should set a property named 'forge.exdocpickerbase.version' to a version of this plugin! --> <dependency> <groupId>org.onehippo.forge.exdocpickerbase</groupId> <artifactId>exdocpickerbase-richtext-ckeditor</artifactId> <version>${forge.exdocpickerbase.version}</version> </dependency>
<!-- SNIP -->
</dependencies>
<!-- SNIP -->
</dependencyManagement>

subsection.p: And add the following dependency reference into your Hippo CMS Web Application module subproject.

subsection.name: Add Configuration
subsection.p: In order to enable the exdocpickerbase CKEditor plugin, you should customize CKEditor configuration for a RichText editor.

In a nutshell, you should add 'exdocpickerbase' as extra CKEditor plugin in the ckeditor.config.overlayed.json property like the following example: (See CKEditor configuration properties for details on those properties.)
And, you should add configurations for 'exdocpickerbase' CKEditor plugin additionally in the ckeditor.config.appended.json like the following example:
For example, the configuration change shown above can be made for /hippo:namespaces/hippostd/html node in order to apply the exdocpickerbase CKEditor plugin globally to all RichText fields.
Now, you're ready to use the plugin!
